headline: Banks eye Venezuela investment, JPMorgan seen with advantage
summary: NEW YORK/HOUSTON, Jan 9 (Reuters) - The U. involvement in Venezuela's oil sector offers a potential opportunity for international banks, with JPMorgan Chase in an advantageous spot due to its history in the country and past involvement with international trade financing.

headline: Why The Narrative Around Smith Douglas Homes (SDHC) Is Shifting After JPMorgan’s Trimmed Target
summary: Why the Price Target Shifted While the Core Valuation Stayed Put Smith Douglas Homes is back in focus as JPMorgan trims its price target to $17 from $18, even while the fair value anchor used in the model holds steady at $16.75. Behind that move, the key building blocks of the narrative, including the discount rate and revenue growth assumptions, have only inched around the edges rather than being overhauled. That small reset sits alongside commentary that still flags solid return on equity...

headline: Banks to report earnings next week: 3 things investors are watching
summary: Earnings season is close to kicking off for big banks, with companies JPMorgan Chase (JPM), Bank of America (BAC), Citigroup (C), Morgan Stanley (MS), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Goldman Sachs (GS) set to report their quarterly results throughout next week. Major US bank stocks notably ended 2025 at new record highs. Yahoo Finance senior bank reporter David Hollerith lists the three biggest themes that Wall Street investors will be watching from bank earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Insmed Provides Business Update at 44th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference
summary: Insmed Incorporated (Nasdaq: INSM), a people-first global biopharmaceutical company striving to deliver first- and best-in-class therapies to transform the lives of patients facing serious diseases, today provided an update on the Company's commercial and clinical programs and its outlook for 2026. These updates will be discussed as part of the Company's presentation at the 44th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference in San Francisco on Monday, January 12, 2026, at 3:00 p.m. PT (6:00 p.m. ET).

headline: How To Earn $500 A Month From JPMorgan Stock Ahead Of Q4 Earnings
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM) will release earnings results for the fourth quarter, before the opening bell on Tuesday, Jan. 13, 2025. Analysts expect the bank to report quarterly earnings at $5.01 per share, up from $4.81 per share in the year-ago period. The consensus estimate for JPMorgan's quarterly revenue is $46.25 billion, up from $42.77 billion a year earlier, according to data from Benzinga Pro. headline: How Recent Moves Are Rewriting The Story For Archer Daniels Midland ADM
summary: Archer Daniels Midland just saw its fair value estimate edge to about US$57.09 per share, a very small change that keeps the stock in roughly the same price range even as the story around its earnings outlook becomes more debated. With Q3 earnings ahead of estimates and a fresh US$59 price target from JPMorgan, the latest update reflects a balance between support from recent results and caution around profit headwinds that analysts continue to flag. Read on to see how you can keep track of...

headline: How The Narrative Around Rightmove (LSE:RMV) Is Shifting With AI Plans And Downgrades
summary: Rightmove’s latest valuation work keeps the core fair value anchor steady at £6.57 per share, even as the surrounding narrative has become more cautious with a series of price target cuts and rating downgrades. Analysts are rethinking how much risk to attach to the new artificial intelligence driven plan and a tougher competitive backdrop, which helps explain why targets, such as JPMorgan’s moves from £6.27 to £5.55 and then to £5.00, have been reset even without a change to the central fair...

headline: What Analysts Think Is Changing The Story For Amazon.com (AMZN)
summary: Amazon.com’s modeled fair value has barely moved, shifting from about US$295.53 to about US$295.51 per share, even as the discount rate, long term revenue growth assumptions and views around AI related cloud demand, advertising and retail all continue to be debated. This tiny change reflects how bullish arguments around large AI infrastructure deals and advertising momentum are being weighed against concerns about heavier capital spending and cloud economics. As these cross currents keep...
